title: Stephen Denmark
text:
Stephen Denmark (born April 20, 1996) is an <a href="American%20football">American football</a> <a href="cornerback">cornerback</a> who is a free agent. He played <a href="college%20football">college football</a> at <a href="Valdosta%20State%20Blazers%20football">Valdosta State</a>. He was drafted by the <a href="Chicago%20Bears">Chicago Bears</a> in the seventh round of the <a href="2019%20NFL%20Draft">2019 NFL Draft</a>.
Early life.
At <a href="James%20S.%20Rickards%20High%20School">James S. Rickards High School</a>, Denmark ran track and played for the <a href="high%20school%20football">football</a> team. In 2013, Rickards reached the Class 5A state playoffs with a 9–2 record; Denmark had 49 receptions for 851 yards and 12 touchdowns, along with two kickoff return touchdowns.
College career.
Denmark attended <a href="Valdosta%20State%20Blazers%20football">Valdosta State</a>, where he played <a href="wide%20receiver">wide receiver</a> for three years. In 2018, Denmark converted to cornerback, where he recorded 55 tackles and three interceptions as Valdosta State won the <a href="NCAA%20Division%20II%20Football%20Championship">NCAA Division II Football Championship</a>.
Professional career.
Chicago Bears.
Denmark was drafted by the <a href="Chicago%20Bears">Chicago Bears</a> in the seventh round (238th overall) of the <a href="2019%20NFL%20Draft">2019 NFL Draft</a>. Before the draft, Denmark worked out with Bears secondary coach <a href="Deshea%20Townsend">Deshea Townsend</a> and assistant director of player personnel Champ Kelly. He signed his four-year rookie contract on May 13.
On August 31, 2019, the Bears released Denmark as part of final roster cuts and was signed to the practice squad the next day. On December 30, 2019, Denmark was signed to a reserve/future contract.
After being waived on September 5, 2020, Denmark was added to the practice squad a day later. He was released on October 5.
Cleveland Browns.
On November 10, 2020, Denmark was signed to the <a href="Cleveland%20Browns">Cleveland Browns</a>' practice squad. Denmark was released from the Browns' practice squad on December 1, 2020.
Pittsburgh Steelers.
On January 21, 2021, Denmark signed a reserve/future contract with the Pittsburgh Steelers. He was waived on August 17, 2021.
Green Bay Packers.
On August 25, 2021, Denmark signed with the <a href="Green%20Bay%20Packers">Green Bay Packers</a>. On August 31, 2021, Packers released Denmark as part of their final roster cuts.
